oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Model 1863 Springfield Rifle-Musket with bayonet
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This .58 caliber rifle-musket was adopted by the US Army as the official issue musket in 1863. The weapon incorporated several changes from the Model 1861 Springfield and also included simpler barrel retaining bands as found on the British Enfield.; The Model 1863 was issued to US soldiers begining in the winter of 1864. The weapon was commonly used by troops on occupation duty and United States Colored Troops in Tennessee.
